intro: Leucophyta sonderi, commonly known as the white-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its pale green to white leaves and yellow-centered flower heads. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Leucophyta sonderi is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
